sec.div: Transforming Chemical Potentials E°(Major Species at pH = 0) to Biochemical Potentials, E′°(pH = 7)
sec.p:
Having estimated the standard redox potential E°(major species at pH = 0), we use cheminformatic p K a estimates of reactants and the Alberty–Legendre transform
41 (p 67, eqs 4.4–10) to convert E°(major species at pH = 0) to the transformed standard redox potential, E′°(pH = 7), which is a function of pH.
63 To estimate the p K a’s of all reactants in every redox reaction of interest, we use the ChemAxon calculator plugin (Marvin 17.7.0, 2017, ChemAxon) cxcalc pka. Internally, the p K a calculator plugin is based on the calculation of the partial charge of atoms in the molecule.
